text: Edwin Cole Bearss (; June 26, 1923 â€“ September 15, 2020) was an American military historian and writer. He was a United States Marine Corps veteran of World War II. He was known for his work on the American Civil War and World War II eras. He was a tour guide of historic battlefields for The Smithsonian Associates and was Chief Historian of the National Park Service from 1981 to 1994. He was born in Billings, Montana. Bearss died at his home in Arlington, Virginia on September 15, 2020 at the age of 97.Ed Bearss, Past Chief Historian Of National Park Service, Dies At 97 ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American historians Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Writers from Montana Category:People from Billings, Montana Category:Military people from Montana Category:United States Marine Corps personnel
